00137 UINT32 SetHistoryFact( UINT8 ubCode, UINT8 ubSecondCode, UINT32 uiDate, INT16 sSectorX, INT16 sSectorY )
00138 {
00139       // adds History item to player's log(History List), returns unique id number of it
00140       // outside of the History system(the code in this .c file), this is the only function you'll ever need
00141   UINT32 uiId=0;
00142       UINT8 ubColor = 0;
00143   HistoryUnitPtr pHistory = pHistoryListHead;
00144   
00145       // clear the list
00146   ClearHistoryList( );
00147 
00148       // process the actual data
00149       if( ubCode == HISTORY_QUEST_FINISHED )
00150       {
00151             ubColor = 0;
00152       }
00153       else
00154       {
00155             ubColor = 1;
00156       }
00157   uiId = ProcessAndEnterAHistoryRecord(ubCode, uiDate,  ubSecondCode, sSectorX, sSectorY, 0, ubColor);
00158       ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, pMessageStrings[ MSG_HISTORY_UPDATED ] );
00159       
00160       // history list head
00161   pHistory = pHistoryListHead;
00162   
00163       // append to end of file
00164   AppendHistoryToEndOfFile( pHistory );
00165   
00166       
00167       // if in history mode, reload current page
00168   if( fInHistoryMode )
00169       {
00170         iCurrentHistoryPage--;
00171     
00172             // load in first page
00173         LoadNextHistoryPage( );
00174       }
00175  
00176 
00177       // return unique id of this transaction
00178       return uiId;
00179 }

00326 BOOLEAN LoadHistory( void )
00327 {
00328   VOBJECT_DESC    VObjectDesc;
00329   // load History video objects into memory
00330 
00331       // title bar
00332   VObjectDesc.fCreateFlags=VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00333       FilenameForBPP("LAPTOP\\programtitlebar.sti", VObjectDesc.ImageFile);
00334       CHECKF(AddVideoObject(&VObjectDesc, &guiTITLE));
00335   
00336       // top portion of the screen background
00337       VObjectDesc.fCreateFlags=VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00338       FilenameForBPP("LAPTOP\\historywindow.sti", VObjectDesc.ImageFile);
00339       CHECKF(AddVideoObject(&VObjectDesc, &guiTOP));
00340   
00341       
00342   // shaded line
00343   VObjectDesc.fCreateFlags=VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00344       FilenameForBPP("LAPTOP\\historylines.sti", VObjectDesc.ImageFile);
00345       CHECKF(AddVideoObject(&VObjectDesc, &guiSHADELINE));
00346 
00347 /*
00348 Not being used???  DF commented out 
00349   // vert  line
00350   VObjectDesc.fCreateFlags=VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00351       FilenameForBPP("LAPTOP\\historyvertline.sti", VObjectDesc.ImageFile);
00352       CHECKF(AddVideoObject(&VObjectDesc, &guiVERTLINE));
00353 */
00354   // black divider line - long ( 480 length)
00355   VObjectDesc.fCreateFlags=VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00356       FilenameForBPP("LAPTOP\\divisionline480.sti", VObjectDesc.ImageFile);
00357       CHECKF(AddVideoObject(&VObjectDesc, &guiLONGLINE));
00358       
00359       return (TRUE);
00360 }

00375 void RenderHistoryBackGround( void )
00376 {
00377       // render generic background for history system
00378   HVOBJECT hHandle;
00379   INT32 iCounter=0;
00380       
00381       // get title bar object
00382       GetVideoObject(&hHandle, guiTITLE); 
00383       
00384       // blt title bar to screen
00385       BltVideoObject(FRAME_BUFFER, hHandle, 0,TOP_X, TOP_Y -2 , VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY,NULL);
00386       
00387 
00388       // get and blt the top part of the screen, video object and blt to screen
00389   GetVideoObject(&hHandle, guiTOP);
00390   BltVideoObject(FRAME_BUFFER, hHandle, 0,TOP_X, TOP_Y + 22, VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY,NULL);
00391       
00392   // display background for history list
00393   DisplayHistoryListBackground( );
00394             return;
00395 }

00417                                                             BUTTON_TOGGLE, MSYS_PRIORITY_HIGHEST - 1,

00423                                                             BUTTON_TOGGLE, MSYS_PRIORITY_HIGHEST - 1,
00424                                                                   (GUI_CALLBACK)BtnGenericMouseMoveButtonCallback, (GUI_CALLBACK)BtnHistoryDisplayNextPageCallBack);
00425

00451 void BtnHistoryDisplayPrevPageCallBack(GUI_BUTTON *btn,INT32 reason)
00452 {
00453       // force redraw
00454       if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
00455       {
00456             fReDrawScreenFlag=TRUE; 
00457       }
00458 
00459 
00460       // force redraw
00461       if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP )
00462       {
00463             fReDrawScreenFlag=TRUE;
00464             btn->uiFlags&=~(BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
00465             // this page is > 0, there are pages before it, decrement
00466 
00467             if(iCurrentHistoryPage > 0)
00468             {
00469                   LoadPreviousHistoryPage( );
00470                   //iCurrentHistoryPage--;
00471               DrawAPageofHistoryRecords( );
00472             }
00473 
00474             // set new state
00475             SetHistoryButtonStates( );
00476       }
00477 
00478       
00479 }
00480 
00481 void BtnHistoryDisplayNextPageCallBack(GUI_BUTTON *btn,INT32 reason)
00482 {
00483 
00484       if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
00485       {
00486             fReDrawScreenFlag=TRUE;   
00487       }
00488 
00489 
00490       // force redraw
00491       if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP )
00492       {
00493     // increment currentPage
00494     btn->uiFlags&=~(BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
00495             LoadNextHistoryPage( );
00496             // set new state
00497             SetHistoryButtonStates( );
00498             fReDrawScreenFlag=TRUE;             
00499       }
00500 
00501       
00502 
00503 }

00505 BOOLEAN IncrementCurrentPageHistoryDisplay( void )
00506 {
00507   // run through list, from pCurrentHistory, to NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE +1 HistoryUnits
00508   HistoryUnitPtr pTempHistory=pCurrentHistory;
00509       BOOLEAN fOkToIncrementPage=FALSE;
00510       INT32 iCounter=0;
00511       HWFILE hFileHandle;
00512       UINT32      uiFileSize=0;
00513       UINT32  uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage = 0;
00514       
00515       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
00516             return( FALSE );
00517 
00518       // open file
00519       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
00520 
00521       // failed to get file, return
00522       if(!hFileHandle)
00523       {
00524             return( FALSE );
00525   }
00526 
00527       // make sure file is more than 0 length
00528   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
00529       {
00530     FileClose( hFileHandle );
00531             return( FALSE );
00532       }
00533 
00534       uiFileSize = FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) - 1;
00535       uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage = ( NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * ( sizeof( UINT8 ) + sizeof( UINT32 ) + 3*sizeof( UINT8 )+ sizeof(INT16) + sizeof( INT16 ) ) );
00536 
00537   // is the file long enough?
00538 //  if( ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) - 1 ) / ( NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * ( sizeof( UINT8 ) + sizeof( UINT32 ) + 3*sizeof( UINT8 )+ sizeof(INT16) + sizeof( INT16 ) ) ) + 1 < ( UINT32 )( iCurrentHistoryPage + 1 ) )
00539       if( uiFileSize / uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage + 1 < ( UINT32 )( iCurrentHistoryPage + 1 ) )
00540       {
00541             // nope
00542             FileClose( hFileHandle );
00543     return( FALSE );
00544       }
00545       else
00546       {
00547             iCurrentHistoryPage++;
00548             FileClose( hFileHandle );
00549       }
00550 
00551 
00552       /*
00553       // haven't reached end of list and not yet at beginning of next page
00554       while( ( pTempHistory )&&( ! fOkToIncrementPage ) )
00555       {
00556     // found the next page,  first record thereof
00557             if(iCounter==NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE+1)
00558             {
00559                   fOkToIncrementPage=TRUE;
00560               pCurrentHistory=pTempHistory->Next;
00561             }
00562 
00563             //next record
00564             pTempHistory=pTempHistory->Next;
00565     iCounter++;
00566       }
00567 */
00568       // if ok to increment, increment
00569  
00570 
00571       return( TRUE );
00572 }

00574 
00575 UINT32 ProcessAndEnterAHistoryRecord( UINT8 ubCode, UINT32 uiDate, UINT8 ubSecondCode, INT16 sSectorX, INT16 sSectorY, INT8 bSectorZ , UINT8 ubColor )
00576 {
00577   UINT32 uiId=0;
00578   HistoryUnitPtr pHistory=pHistoryListHead;
00579 
00580       // add to History list
00581       if(pHistory)
00582       {
00583             // go to end of list
00584             while(pHistory->Next)
00585                   pHistory=pHistory->Next;
00586             
00587             // alloc space
00588             pHistory->Next = (history *) MemAlloc(sizeof(HistoryUnit));
00589             
00590             // increment id number
00591             uiId = pHistory->uiIdNumber + 1;
00592             
00593             // set up information passed
00594             pHistory = pHistory->Next;
00595             pHistory->Next = NULL;
00596             pHistory->ubCode = ubCode;
00597     pHistory->ubSecondCode = ubSecondCode;
00598             pHistory->uiDate = uiDate;
00599     pHistory->uiIdNumber = uiId;
00600             pHistory->sSectorX = sSectorX;
00601             pHistory->sSectorY = sSectorY;
00602             pHistory->bSectorZ = bSectorZ;
00603             pHistory->ubColor = ubColor;
00604     
00605       }
00606       else
00607       {
00608             // alloc space
00609             pHistory = (HistoryUnitPtr) MemAlloc(sizeof(HistoryUnit));
00610     
00611             // setup info passed
00612             pHistory->Next = NULL;
00613             pHistory->ubCode = ubCode;
00614     pHistory->ubSecondCode = ubSecondCode;
00615             pHistory->uiDate = uiDate;
00616     pHistory->uiIdNumber = uiId;
00617         pHistoryListHead = pHistory;
00618             pHistory->sSectorX = sSectorX;
00619             pHistory->sSectorY = sSectorY;
00620             pHistory->bSectorZ = bSectorZ;
00621             pHistory->ubColor = ubColor;
00622 
00623       }
00624 
00625       return uiId;
00626 }

00629 void OpenAndReadHistoryFile( void )
00630 {
00631   // this procedure will open and read in data to the History list
00632   
00633       HWFILE hFileHandle;
00634   UINT8 ubCode, ubSecondCode;
00635       UINT32 uiDate;
00636   INT16 sSectorX, sSectorY;
00637       INT8 bSectorZ = 0;
00638       UINT8 ubColor;
00639   INT32 iBytesRead=0;
00640   UINT32 uiByteCount=0;
00641 
00642       // clear out the old list
00643       ClearHistoryList( );
00644 
00645       // no file, return
00646       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
00647             return;
00648 
00649       // open file
00650       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
00651 
00652       // failed to get file, return
00653       if(!hFileHandle)
00654       {
00655             return;
00656   }
00657 
00658       // make sure file is more than 0 length
00659   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
00660       {
00661     FileClose( hFileHandle );
00662             return;
00663       }
00664  
00665       // file exists, read in data, continue until file end
00666   while( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) > uiByteCount)
00667       {
00668             // read in other data
00669     FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubCode, sizeof(UINT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00670             FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubSecondCode, sizeof(UINT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00671             FileRead( hFileHandle, &uiDate, sizeof(UINT32), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00672     FileRead( hFileHandle, &sSectorX, sizeof(INT16), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00673     FileRead( hFileHandle, &sSectorY, sizeof(INT16), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00674             FileRead( hFileHandle, &bSectorZ, sizeof(INT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00675             FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubColor, sizeof( UINT8 ), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
00676 
00677             #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00678             //perform a check on the data to see if it is pooched
00679             PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( 1, sSectorX, sSectorY, bSectorZ );
00680             #endif
00681 
00682             // add transaction
00683         ProcessAndEnterAHistoryRecord( ubCode, uiDate, ubSecondCode, sSectorX, sSectorY, bSectorZ, ubColor );
00684 
00685             // increment byte counter
00686         uiByteCount +=  SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD;
00687       } 
00688       
00689   // close file 
00690       FileClose( hFileHandle );
00691       
00692       return;
00693 }
00694 
00695 BOOLEAN OpenAndWriteHistoryFile( void )
00696 {
00697   // this procedure will open and write out data from the History list
00698  
00699       HWFILE hFileHandle;
00700   INT32 iBytesWritten=0;
00701   HistoryUnitPtr pHistoryList=pHistoryListHead;
00702       
00703   
00704       // open file
00705       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE, FILE_ACCESS_WRITE|FILE_CREATE_ALWAYS, FALSE);
00706 
00707       // if no file exits, do nothing
00708       if(!hFileHandle)
00709       {
00710             return ( FALSE );
00711   }
00712   // write info, while there are elements left in the list
00713   while(pHistoryList)
00714       {
00715 
00716             #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00717             //perform a check on the data to see if it is pooched
00718             PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( 2, pHistoryList->sSectorX, pHistoryList->sSectorY, pHistoryList->bSectorZ );
00719             #endif
00720 
00721       // now write date and amount, and code
00722     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
00723     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubSecondCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
00724             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->uiDate ),  sizeof ( UINT32 ), NULL );
00725     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->sSectorX ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL );
00726             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->sSectorY ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL );
00727             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->bSectorZ ),  sizeof ( INT8 ), NULL );
00728             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubColor ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
00729 
00730             // next element in list
00731             pHistoryList = pHistoryList->Next;
00732       
00733       }
00734 
00735       // close file
00736   FileClose( hFileHandle );
00737   // clear out the old list
00738       ClearHistoryList( );
00739 
00740       return ( TRUE );
00741 }
00742 
00743 
00744 void ClearHistoryList( void )
00745 {
00746       // remove each element from list of transactions
00747   
00748       HistoryUnitPtr pHistoryList=pHistoryListHead;
00749   HistoryUnitPtr pHistoryNode=pHistoryList;
00750 
00751       // while there are elements in the list left, delete them
00752       while( pHistoryList )
00753       {
00754     // set node to list head
00755             pHistoryNode=pHistoryList;
00756             
00757             // set list head to next node
00758             pHistoryList=pHistoryList->Next;
00759     
00760             // delete current node
00761             MemFree(pHistoryNode);
00762       }
00763   pHistoryListHead=NULL;
00764       
00765       return;
00766 }
00767 
00768 void DisplayHistoryListHeaders( void )
00769 {
00770   // this procedure will display the headers to each column in History
00771   UINT16 usX, usY;
00772 
00773       // font stuff
00774       SetFont(HISTORY_TEXT_FONT);
00775   SetFontForeground(FONT_BLACK);
00776       SetFontBackground(FONT_BLACK);
00777       SetFontShadow(NO_SHADOW); 
00778   
00779   // the date header
00780   FindFontCenterCoordinates(RECORD_DATE_X + 5,0,RECORD_DATE_WIDTH,0, pHistoryHeaders[0], HISTORY_TEXT_FONT,&usX, &usY);
00781       mprintf(usX, RECORD_HEADER_Y, pHistoryHeaders[0]);
00782       
00783       // the date header
00784   FindFontCenterCoordinates(RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH + 5,0,RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH,0, pHistoryHeaders[ 3 ], HISTORY_TEXT_FONT,&usX, &usY);
00785       mprintf(usX, RECORD_HEADER_Y, pHistoryHeaders[3]);
00786 
00787       // event header
00788   FindFontCenterCoordinates(RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH + RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH + 5,0,RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH,0, pHistoryHeaders[ 3 ], HISTORY_TEXT_FONT,&usX, &usY);
00789       mprintf(usX, RECORD_HEADER_Y, pHistoryHeaders[4]);
00790       // reset shadow
00791       SetFontShadow(DEFAULT_SHADOW);
00792       return;
00793 }

00801   
00802 
00803

00805       GetVideoObject(&hHandle, guiSHADELINE);
00806       for(iCounter=0; iCounter <11; iCounter++)
00807       {

00809         BltVideoObject(FRAME_BUFFER, hHandle, 0,TOP_X + 15, (TOP_DIVLINE_Y + BOX_HEIGHT * 2 * iCounter), VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY,NULL);
00810       }

00816

00818       return;

00820 
00821 void DrawHistoryRecordsText( void )
00822 {
00823   // draws the text of the records
00824   HistoryUnitPtr pCurHistory=pHistoryListHead;
00825   HistoryUnitPtr pTempHistory=pHistoryListHead;
00826       wchar_t sString[512];
00827   INT32 iCounter=0;
00828       UINT16 usX, usY;
00829   INT32 iBalance=0;
00830       INT16 sX =0, sY =0;
00831 
00832   // setup the font stuff
00833       SetFont(HISTORY_TEXT_FONT);
00834   SetFontForeground(FONT_BLACK);
00835       SetFontBackground(FONT_BLACK);
00836   SetFontShadow(NO_SHADOW);
00837 
00838       // error check
00839       if( !pCurHistory)
00840             return;
00841 
00842 
00843       // loop through record list
00844       for(iCounter; iCounter <NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE; iCounter++)
00845       {
00846             if( pCurHistory->ubColor == 0 )
00847             {
00848                   SetFontForeground(FONT_BLACK);
00849             }
00850             else
00851             {
00852                   SetFontForeground(FONT_RED);
00853             }
00854             // get and write the date
00855             swprintf(sString, L"%d", ( pCurHistory->uiDate / ( 24 * 60 ) ) );
00856             FindFontCenterCoordinates(RECORD_DATE_X + 5, 0, RECORD_DATE_WIDTH,0, sString, HISTORY_TEXT_FONT,&usX, &usY);
00857             mprintf(usX, RECORD_Y + ( iCounter * ( BOX_HEIGHT ) ) + 3, sString);
00858         
00859             // now the actual history text
00860     //FindFontCenterCoordinates(RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH,0,RECORD_HISTORY_WIDTH,0,  pHistoryStrings[pCurHistory->ubCode], HISTORY_TEXT_FONT,&usX, &usY);
00861             ProcessHistoryTransactionString(sString, pCurHistory);
00862 //    mprintf(RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH + 25, RECORD_Y + ( iCounter * ( BOX_HEIGHT ) ) + 3, pHistoryStrings[pCurHistory->ubCode] );
00863             mprintf(RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH +RECORD_DATE_WIDTH + 15, RECORD_Y + ( iCounter * ( BOX_HEIGHT ) ) + 3, sString );
00864     
00865             
00866             // no location
00867             if( ( pCurHistory->sSectorX == -1 )||( pCurHistory->sSectorY == -1 ) )
00868             {
00869                   FindFontCenterCoordinates( RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH, 0,RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH + 10, 0,  pHistoryLocations[0] ,HISTORY_TEXT_FONT, &sX, &sY );
00870               mprintf(sX, RECORD_Y + ( iCounter * ( BOX_HEIGHT ) ) + 3, pHistoryLocations[0] );
00871     }
00872             else
00873             {
00874                   GetSectorIDString( pCurHistory->sSectorX, pCurHistory->sSectorY, pCurHistory->bSectorZ, sString, TRUE );
00875                   FindFontCenterCoordinates( RECORD_DATE_X + RECORD_DATE_WIDTH, 0, RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH + 10, 0,  sString ,HISTORY_TEXT_FONT, &sX, &sY );
00876       
00877                   ReduceStringLength( sString, RECORD_LOCATION_WIDTH + 10, HISTORY_TEXT_FONT );
00878                   
00879                   mprintf(sX, RECORD_Y + ( iCounter * ( BOX_HEIGHT ) ) + 3, sString );
00880             }
00881 
00882             // restore font color
00883             SetFontForeground(FONT_BLACK);
00884 
00885             // next History
00886             pCurHistory = pCurHistory->Next;
00887             
00888             // last page, no Historys left, return
00889             if( ! pCurHistory )
00890             {
00891 
00892                   // restore shadow
00893       SetFontShadow(DEFAULT_SHADOW);      
00894                   return;
00895             }
00896 
00897       }
00898 
00899       // restore shadow
00900   SetFontShadow(DEFAULT_SHADOW);    
00901       return;
00902 }

00904 
00905 void DrawAPageofHistoryRecords( void )
00906 {
00907       // this procedure will draw a series of history records to the screen
00908   INT32 iCurPage=1;
00909       INT32 iCount=0;
00910   pCurrentHistory=pHistoryListHead;
00911 
00912       // (re-)render background
00913       
00914       // the title bar text
00915        DrawHistoryTitleText( );
00916   
00917         // the actual lists background
00918        DisplayHistoryListBackground( );
00919 
00920        // the headers to each column
00921        DisplayHistoryListHeaders( );
00922 
00923   
00924       // error check
00925       if(iCurrentHistoryPage==-1)
00926       {
00927             iCurrentHistoryPage=0;
00928   }
00929       
00930       
00931       // current page is found, render  from here
00932       DrawHistoryRecordsText( );
00933 
00934       // update page numbers, and date ranges
00935       DisplayPageNumberAndDateRange( );
00936 
00937       return;
00938 }
00939 
00940 void DisplayPageNumberAndDateRange( void )
00941 {
00942       // this function will go through the list of 'histories' starting at current until end or 
00943       // MAX_PER_PAGE...it will get the date range and the page number
00944       INT32 iLastPage=0;
00945       INT32 iCounter=0;
00946   UINT32 uiLastDate;
00947       HistoryUnitPtr pTempHistory=pHistoryListHead;
00948   wchar_t sString[50];
00949 
00950 
00951 
00952   // setup the font stuff
00953       SetFont(HISTORY_TEXT_FONT);
00954   SetFontForeground(FONT_BLACK);
00955       SetFontBackground(FONT_BLACK);
00956   SetFontShadow(NO_SHADOW);
00957 
00958       if( !pCurrentHistory )
00959       {
00960     swprintf( sString, L"%s  %d / %d",pHistoryHeaders[1], 1, 1 );
00961         mprintf( PAGE_NUMBER_X, PAGE_NUMBER_Y, sString );
00962 
00963     swprintf( sString, L"%s %d - %d",pHistoryHeaders[2], 1 , 1 );
00964     mprintf( HISTORY_DATE_X, HISTORY_DATE_Y, sString );
00965  
00966     // reset shadow
00967         SetFontShadow(DEFAULT_SHADOW);    
00968       
00969             return;
00970   }
00971  
00972       uiLastDate=pCurrentHistory->uiDate;
00973 
00974 /*
00975       // find last page
00976       while(pTempHistory)
00977       {
00978             iCounter++;
00979             pTempHistory=pTempHistory->Next;
00980       }
00981 
00982   // set last page
00983       iLastPage=iCounter/NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE;
00984 */
00985 
00986       iLastPage = GetNumberOfHistoryPages();
00987 
00988       // set temp to current, to get last date
00989   pTempHistory=pCurrentHistory;
00990       
00991       // reset counter
00992       iCounter=0;
00993 
00994       // run through list until end or num_records, which ever first
00995   while((pTempHistory)&&(iCounter < NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE))
00996       {
00997             uiLastDate=pTempHistory->uiDate;
00998             iCounter++;
00999 
01000             pTempHistory = pTempHistory->Next;
01001       }
01002 
01003   
01004 
01005       // get the last page
01006    
01007   swprintf( sString, L"%s  %d / %d",pHistoryHeaders[1], iCurrentHistoryPage , iLastPage +1 );
01008       mprintf( PAGE_NUMBER_X, PAGE_NUMBER_Y, sString );
01009 
01010   swprintf( sString, L"%s %d - %d",pHistoryHeaders[2], pCurrentHistory->uiDate / ( 24 * 60 ) , uiLastDate/( 24 * 60 ) );
01011   mprintf( HISTORY_DATE_X, HISTORY_DATE_Y, sString );
01012 
01013       
01014       // reset shadow
01015       SetFontShadow(DEFAULT_SHADOW);
01016       
01017       return;
01018 }
01019 
01020 
01021 void ProcessHistoryTransactionString(STR16 pString, HistoryUnitPtr pHistory)
01022 {
01023       CHAR16 sString[ 128 ];
01024 
01025       switch( pHistory->ubCode)
01026       {
01027             case HISTORY_ENTERED_HISTORY_MODE:
01028                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_ENTERED_HISTORY_MODE ]);
01029                   break;
01030 
01031             case HISTORY_HIRED_MERC_FROM_AIM:
01032                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_HIRED_MERC_FROM_AIM ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zName  );
01033                   break;
01034 
01035             case HISTORY_MERC_KILLED:
01036                   if( pHistory->ubSecondCode != NO_PROFILE )
01037                         swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_KILLED ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zName );
01038 #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
01039                   else
01040                   {
01041                         swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_KILLED ], L"ERROR!!!  NO_PROFILE" );
01042                   }
01043 #endif
01044                   break;
01045 
01046             case HISTORY_HIRED_MERC_FROM_MERC:
01047                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_HIRED_MERC_FROM_MERC ],  gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zName );
01048                   break;
01049 
01050             case HISTORY_SETTLED_ACCOUNTS_AT_MERC:
01051                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_SETTLED_ACCOUNTS_AT_MERC ] );
01052                   break;
01053             case HISTORY_ACCEPTED_ASSIGNMENT_FROM_ENRICO:
01054                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_ACCEPTED_ASSIGNMENT_FROM_ENRICO ] );
01055                   break;
01056             case( HISTORY_CHARACTER_GENERATED ):
01057                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_CHARACTER_GENERATED ] );
01058               break;
01059             case( HISTORY_PURCHASED_INSURANCE ):
01060                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_PURCHASED_INSURANCE ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01061               break;
01062             case( HISTORY_CANCELLED_INSURANCE ):
01063                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_CANCELLED_INSURANCE ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01064               break;
01065             case( HISTORY_INSURANCE_CLAIM_PAYOUT ):
01066                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_INSURANCE_CLAIM_PAYOUT ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01067               break;
01068 
01069             case HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_1_DAY:
01070                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_1_DAY ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01071                   break;
01072 
01073             case HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_1_WEEK:
01074                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_1_WEEK ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01075                   break;
01076 
01077             case HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_2_WEEK:
01078                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_EXTENDED_CONTRACT_2_WEEK ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01079                   break;
01080             
01081             case( HISTORY_MERC_FIRED ):
01082                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_FIRED ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01083               break;
01084 
01085             case( HISTORY_MERC_QUIT ):
01086                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_QUIT ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01087               break;
01088 
01089             case( HISTORY_QUEST_STARTED ):
01090                   GetQuestStartedString( pHistory->ubSecondCode, sString );
01091                   swprintf(pString, sString );
01092 
01093               break;
01094             case( HISTORY_QUEST_FINISHED ):
01095                   GetQuestEndedString( pHistory->ubSecondCode, sString );
01096                   swprintf(pString, sString );
01097 
01098               break;
01099             case( HISTORY_TALKED_TO_MINER ):
01100                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_TALKED_TO_MINER ], pTownNames[ pHistory->ubSecondCode ] );
01101               break;
01102             case( HISTORY_LIBERATED_TOWN ):
01103                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_LIBERATED_TOWN ], pTownNames[ pHistory->ubSecondCode ] );
01104                   break;
01105             case( HISTORY_CHEAT_ENABLED ):
01106                   swprintf(pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_CHEAT_ENABLED ] );
01107                   break;
01108             case HISTORY_TALKED_TO_FATHER_WALKER:
01109                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_TALKED_TO_FATHER_WALKER ] );
01110                   break;
01111             case HISTORY_MERC_MARRIED_OFF:
01112                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_MARRIED_OFF ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01113                   break;
01114             case HISTORY_MERC_CONTRACT_EXPIRED:
01115                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_MERC_CONTRACT_EXPIRED ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zName );
01116                   break;
01117             case HISTORY_RPC_JOINED_TEAM:
01118                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_RPC_JOINED_TEAM ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zName );
01119                   break;
01120             case HISTORY_ENRICO_COMPLAINED:
01121                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ HISTORY_ENRICO_COMPLAINED ] );
01122                   break;
01123             case HISTORY_MINE_RUNNING_OUT:
01124             case HISTORY_MINE_RAN_OUT:
01125             case HISTORY_MINE_SHUTDOWN:
01126             case HISTORY_MINE_REOPENED:
01127                   // all the same format

01129                   break;
01130             case HISTORY_LOST_BOXING:
01131             case HISTORY_WON_BOXING:
01132             case HISTORY_DISQUALIFIED_BOXING:
01133             case HISTORY_NPC_KILLED:
01134             case HISTORY_MERC_KILLED_CHARACTER:
01135                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ pHistory->ubCode ], gMercProfiles[pHistory->ubSecondCode].zNickname );
01136                   break;
01137 
01138             // ALL SIMPLE HISTORY LOG MSGS, NO PARAMS
01139             case HISTORY_FOUND_MONEY:
01140             case HISTORY_ASSASSIN:
01141             case HISTORY_DISCOVERED_TIXA:
01142             case HISTORY_DISCOVERED_ORTA:
01143             case HISTORY_GOT_ROCKET_RIFLES:
01144             case HISTORY_DEIDRANNA_DEAD_BODIES:
01145             case HISTORY_BOXING_MATCHES:
01146             case HISTORY_SOMETHING_IN_MINES:
01147             case HISTORY_DEVIN:
01148             case HISTORY_MIKE:
01149             case HISTORY_TONY:
01150             case HISTORY_KROTT:
01151             case HISTORY_KYLE:
01152             case HISTORY_MADLAB:
01153             case HISTORY_GABBY:
01154             case HISTORY_KEITH_OUT_OF_BUSINESS:
01155             case HISTORY_HOWARD_CYANIDE:
01156             case HISTORY_KEITH:
01157             case HISTORY_HOWARD:
01158             case HISTORY_PERKO:
01159             case HISTORY_SAM:
01160             case HISTORY_FRANZ:
01161             case HISTORY_ARNOLD:
01162             case HISTORY_FREDO:
01163             case HISTORY_RICHGUY_BALIME:
01164             case HISTORY_JAKE:
01165             case HISTORY_BUM_KEYCARD:
01166             case HISTORY_WALTER:
01167             case HISTORY_DAVE:
01168             case HISTORY_PABLO:
01169             case HISTORY_KINGPIN_MONEY:
01170             //VARIOUS BATTLE CONDITIONS
01171             case HISTORY_LOSTTOWNSECTOR:
01172             case HISTORY_DEFENDEDTOWNSECTOR:
01173             case HISTORY_LOSTBATTLE:
01174             case HISTORY_WONBATTLE:
01175             case HISTORY_FATALAMBUSH:
01176             case HISTORY_WIPEDOUTENEMYAMBUSH:
01177             case HISTORY_UNSUCCESSFULATTACK:
01178             case HISTORY_SUCCESSFULATTACK:
01179             case HISTORY_CREATURESATTACKED:
01180             case HISTORY_KILLEDBYBLOODCATS:
01181             case HISTORY_SLAUGHTEREDBLOODCATS:
01182             case HISTORY_GAVE_CARMEN_HEAD:
01183             case HISTORY_SLAY_MYSTERIOUSLY_LEFT:
01184                   swprintf( pString, pHistoryStrings[ pHistory->ubCode ] );
01185                   break;
01186       }
01187 }

01198 
01199 void SetHistoryButtonStates( void )
01200 {
01201       // this function will look at what page we are viewing, enable and disable buttons as needed
01202   
01203       if( iCurrentHistoryPage == 1 )
01204       {
01205             // first page, disable left buttons
01206             DisableButton(    giHistoryButton[PREV_PAGE_BUTTON] );
01207         
01208       }
01209       else
01210       {
01211             // enable buttons
01212             EnableButton( giHistoryButton[PREV_PAGE_BUTTON] );
01213         
01214       }
01215 
01216       if( IncrementCurrentPageHistoryDisplay( ) )
01217       {
01218             // decrement page
01219     iCurrentHistoryPage--;
01220             DrawAPageofHistoryRecords( );
01221     
01222             // enable buttons
01223             EnableButton( giHistoryButton[ NEXT_PAGE_BUTTON ] );
01224 
01225       }
01226       else
01227       {
01228     DisableButton(      giHistoryButton[ NEXT_PAGE_BUTTON ] );
01229       }
01230 }
01231 
01232 
01233 BOOLEAN LoadInHistoryRecords( UINT32 uiPage )
01234 {
01235       // loads in records belogning, to page uiPage
01236   // no file, return
01237       BOOLEAN fOkToContinue=TRUE;
01238   INT32 iCount =0;
01239   HWFILE hFileHandle;
01240   UINT8 ubCode, ubSecondCode;
01241       INT16 sSectorX, sSectorY;
01242       INT8  bSectorZ;
01243       UINT32 uiDate;
01244       UINT8 ubColor;
01245   INT32 iBytesRead=0;
01246   UINT32 uiByteCount=0;
01247  
01248       // check if bad page
01249       if( uiPage == 0 )
01250       {
01251             return ( FALSE );
01252       }
01253 
01254 
01255       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
01256             return( FALSE );
01257 
01258       // open file
01259       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
01260 
01261       // failed to get file, return
01262       if(!hFileHandle)
01263       {
01264             return( FALSE );
01265   }
01266 
01267       // make sure file is more than 0 length
01268   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
01269       {
01270     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01271             return( FALSE );
01272       }
01273 
01274   // is the file long enough?
01275   if( ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) - 1 ) / ( NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD ) + 1 < uiPage )
01276       {
01277             // nope
01278             FileClose( hFileHandle );
01279     return( FALSE );
01280       }
01281 
01282       FileSeek( hFileHandle, ( uiPage - 1 ) * NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * ( SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD), FILE_SEEK_FROM_START );
01283   
01284       uiByteCount = ( uiPage  - 1 ) * NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * (SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD );
01285       // file exists, read in data, continue until end of page
01286   while( ( iCount < NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE )&&( fOkToContinue ) )
01287       {
01288     
01289             // read in other data
01290     FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubCode, sizeof(UINT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01291             FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubSecondCode, sizeof(UINT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01292             FileRead( hFileHandle, &uiDate, sizeof(UINT32), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01293     FileRead( hFileHandle, &sSectorX, sizeof(INT16), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01294     FileRead( hFileHandle, &sSectorY, sizeof(INT16), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01295             FileRead( hFileHandle, &bSectorZ, sizeof(INT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01296             FileRead( hFileHandle, &ubColor, sizeof(UINT8), (UINT32 *)&iBytesRead );
01297 
01298             #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
01299             //perform a check on the data to see if it is pooched
01300             PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( 3, sSectorX, sSectorY, bSectorZ );
01301             #endif
01302 
01303             // add transaction
01304     ProcessAndEnterAHistoryRecord(ubCode, uiDate,  ubSecondCode, sSectorX, sSectorY, bSectorZ, ubColor);
01305 
01306             // increment byte counter
01307         uiByteCount += SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD;
01308         
01309             // we've overextended our welcome, and bypassed end of file, get out
01310             if( uiByteCount >=  FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) )
01311             {
01312                   // not ok to continue
01313                   fOkToContinue = FALSE;
01314             }
01315 
01316             iCount++;
01317       } 
01318       
01319   // close file 
01320       FileClose( hFileHandle );
01321 
01322       // check to see if we in fact have a list to display
01323   if( pHistoryListHead == NULL )
01324       {
01325             // got no records, return false
01326             return( FALSE );
01327       }
01328 
01329       // set up current finance
01330       pCurrentHistory = pHistoryListHead;
01331 
01332       return( TRUE );
01333 }
01334 
01335 
01336 BOOLEAN WriteOutHistoryRecords( UINT32 uiPage )
01337 {
01338       // loads in records belogning, to page uiPage
01339   // no file, return
01340       BOOLEAN fOkToContinue=TRUE;
01341   INT32 iCount =0;
01342   HWFILE hFileHandle;
01343       HistoryUnitPtr pList;
01344   INT32 iBytesRead=0;
01345   UINT32 uiByteCount=0;
01346  
01347       // check if bad page
01348       if( uiPage == 0 )
01349       {
01350             return ( FALSE );
01351       }
01352 
01353 
01354       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
01355             return( FALSE );
01356 
01357       // open file
01358       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_WRITE ), FALSE );
01359 
01360       // failed to get file, return
01361       if(!hFileHandle)
01362       {
01363             return( FALSE );
01364   }
01365 
01366       // make sure file is more than 0 length
01367   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
01368       {
01369     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01370             return( FALSE );
01371       }
01372 
01373   // is the file long enough?
01374   if( ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) - 1 ) / ( NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD ) + 1 < uiPage )
01375       {
01376             // nope
01377             FileClose( hFileHandle );
01378     return( FALSE );
01379       }
01380 
01381       pList = pHistoryListHead;
01382       
01383       if( pList == NULL )
01384       {
01385             return( FALSE );
01386       }
01387       
01388       FileSeek( hFileHandle, sizeof( INT32 ) + ( uiPage - 1 ) * NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD, FILE_SEEK_FROM_START );
01389   
01390       uiByteCount = /*sizeof( INT32 )+ */( uiPage - 1 ) * NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD;
01391       // file exists, read in data, continue until end of page
01392   while( ( iCount < NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE )&&( fOkToContinue ) )
01393       {
01394 
01395             #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
01396             //perform a check on the data to see if it is pooched
01397             PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( 4, pList->sSectorX, pList->sSectorY, pList->bSectorZ );
01398             #endif
01399     
01400             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->ubCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
01401     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->ubSecondCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
01402             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->uiDate ),  sizeof ( UINT32 ), NULL );
01403     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->sSectorX ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL );
01404             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->sSectorY ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL );
01405             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->bSectorZ ),  sizeof ( INT8 ), NULL );
01406             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pList->ubColor ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
01407 
01408             pList = pList->Next;
01409 
01410             // we've overextended our welcome, and bypassed end of file, get out
01411             if( pList == NULL )
01412             {
01413                   // not ok to continue
01414                   fOkToContinue = FALSE;
01415             }
01416 
01417             iCount++;
01418       } 
01419       
01420   // close file 
01421       FileClose( hFileHandle );
01422 
01423       ClearHistoryList( );
01424 
01425       return( TRUE );
01426 }
01427 
01428 BOOLEAN LoadNextHistoryPage( void )
01429 {
01430       
01431       // clear out old list of records, and load in previous page worth of records
01432   ClearHistoryList( );
01433 
01434       
01435   
01436       // now load in previous page's records, if we can
01437   if ( LoadInHistoryRecords( iCurrentHistoryPage + 1 ) )
01438       {
01439             iCurrentHistoryPage++;
01440         return ( TRUE );
01441       }
01442       else
01443       {
01444             LoadInHistoryRecords( iCurrentHistoryPage );
01445         return ( FALSE );
01446       }
01447 
01448 }
01449 
01450 
01451 BOOLEAN LoadPreviousHistoryPage( void )
01452 {
01453       
01454       // clear out old list of records, and load in previous page worth of records
01455   ClearHistoryList( );
01456 
01457       // load previous page
01458       if( ( iCurrentHistoryPage == 1 ) )
01459       {
01460             return ( FALSE );
01461       }
01462   
01463       // now load in previous page's records, if we can
01464   if ( LoadInHistoryRecords( iCurrentHistoryPage - 1 ) )
01465       {
01466             iCurrentHistoryPage--;
01467             return ( TRUE );
01468       }
01469       else
01470       {
01471     LoadInHistoryRecords( iCurrentHistoryPage );
01472             return ( FALSE );
01473       }
01474 }

01476 
01477 void SetLastPageInHistoryRecords( void )
01478 {
01479       // grabs the size of the file and interprets number of pages it will take up
01480   HWFILE hFileHandle;
01481   INT32 iBytesRead=0;
01482 
01483       // no file, return
01484       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
01485             return;
01486 
01487       // open file
01488       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
01489 
01490       // failed to get file, return
01491       if(!hFileHandle)
01492       {
01493             guiLastPageInHistoryRecordsList = 1;
01494             return;
01495   }
01496 
01497       // make sure file is more than 0 length
01498   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
01499       {
01500     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01501     guiLastPageInHistoryRecordsList = 1;
01502             return;
01503       }
01504  
01505       
01506       // done with file, close it
01507       FileClose( hFileHandle );
01508 
01509       guiLastPageInHistoryRecordsList = ReadInLastElementOfHistoryListAndReturnIdNumber( ) / NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE;
01510       
01511       return;
01512 }
01513 
01514 UINT32 ReadInLastElementOfHistoryListAndReturnIdNumber( void )
01515 {
01516       // this function will read in the last unit in the history list, to grab it's id number
01517 
01518   
01519   HWFILE hFileHandle;
01520   INT32 iBytesRead=0;
01521   INT32 iFileSize = 0; 
01522 
01523       // no file, return
01524       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
01525             return 0;
01526 
01527       // open file
01528       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
01529 
01530       // failed to get file, return
01531       if(!hFileHandle)
01532       {
01533             return 0;
01534   }
01535 
01536       // make sure file is more than balance size + length of 1 record - 1 byte
01537   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) < SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD )
01538       {
01539     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01540     return 0;
01541       }
01542  
01543       // size is?
01544   iFileSize = FileGetSize( hFileHandle );
01545 
01546       // done with file, close it
01547       FileClose( hFileHandle );
01548 
01549   // file size  / sizeof record in bytes is id
01550       return ( (  iFileSize  ) / ( SIZE_OF_HISTORY_FILE_RECORD ) );
01551   
01552 }

01555 BOOLEAN AppendHistoryToEndOfFile( HistoryUnitPtr pHistory )
01556 {
01557       // will write the current finance to disk
01558   HWFILE hFileHandle;
01559   INT32 iBytesWritten=0;
01560   HistoryUnitPtr pHistoryList=pHistoryListHead;
01561       
01562   
01563       // open file
01564       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE, FILE_ACCESS_WRITE|FILE_OPEN_ALWAYS, FALSE);
01565 
01566       // if no file exits, do nothing
01567       if(!hFileHandle)
01568       {
01569     return ( FALSE );
01570       }
01571   
01572       // go to the end
01573       if( FileSeek( hFileHandle,0,FILE_SEEK_FROM_END ) == FALSE )
01574       {
01575             // error
01576     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01577             return( FALSE );
01578       }
01579 
01580             #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
01581             //perform a check on the data to see if it is pooched
01582             PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( 5, pHistoryList->sSectorX, pHistoryList->sSectorY, pHistoryList->bSectorZ );
01583             #endif
01584 
01585       
01586             // now write date and amount, and code
01587     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
01588     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubSecondCode ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL );
01589             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->uiDate ),  sizeof ( UINT32 ), NULL );
01590     FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->sSectorX ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL );
01591             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->sSectorY ),  sizeof ( INT16 ), NULL ); 
01592             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->bSectorZ ),  sizeof ( INT8 ), NULL ); 
01593             FileWrite( hFileHandle, &(pHistoryList->ubColor ),  sizeof ( UINT8 ), NULL ); 
01594 
01595 
01596             // close file
01597   FileClose( hFileHandle );
01598 
01599   return( TRUE );
01600 }
01601 
01602 void ResetHistoryFact( UINT8 ubCode, INT16 sSectorX, INT16 sSectorY )
01603 {
01604       // run through history list
01605       INT32 iOldHistoryPage = iCurrentHistoryPage;
01606       HistoryUnitPtr pList = pHistoryListHead;
01607       BOOLEAN fFound = FALSE;
01608 
01609       // set current page to before list  
01610       iCurrentHistoryPage = 0;
01611 
01612       SetLastPageInHistoryRecords( );
01613 
01614       OpenAndReadHistoryFile( );
01615 
01616       pList = pHistoryListHead;
01617 
01618       while( pList )
01619       {
01620             if( ( pList -> ubSecondCode == ubCode ) && ( pList->ubCode == HISTORY_QUEST_STARTED ) )
01621             {
01622                   // reset color
01623                   pList -> ubColor = 0;
01624                   fFound = TRUE;
01625                         
01626                   // save
01627                   OpenAndWriteHistoryFile( );
01628                   pList = NULL;
01629             }
01630                   
01631             if( fFound != TRUE )
01632             {
01633                   pList = pList->Next;
01634             }
01635       }
01636       
01637       if( fInHistoryMode )
01638       {
01639         iCurrentHistoryPage--;
01640     
01641             // load in first page
01642         LoadNextHistoryPage( );
01643       }
01644 
01645       SetHistoryFact( HISTORY_QUEST_FINISHED, ubCode, GetWorldTotalMin(), sSectorX, sSectorY );
01646       return;
01647 }

01650 UINT32 GetTimeQuestWasStarted( UINT8 ubCode )
01651 {
01652       // run through history list
01653       INT32 iOldHistoryPage = iCurrentHistoryPage;
01654       HistoryUnitPtr pList = pHistoryListHead;
01655       BOOLEAN fFound = FALSE;
01656       UINT32 uiTime = 0;
01657 
01658       // set current page to before list  
01659       iCurrentHistoryPage = 0;
01660 
01661       SetLastPageInHistoryRecords( );
01662 
01663       OpenAndReadHistoryFile( );
01664 
01665       pList = pHistoryListHead;
01666 
01667       while( pList )
01668       {
01669             if( ( pList -> ubSecondCode == ubCode ) && ( pList->ubCode == HISTORY_QUEST_STARTED ) )
01670             {
01671                   uiTime = pList->uiDate;
01672                   fFound = TRUE;
01673                         
01674                   pList = NULL;
01675             }
01676                   
01677             if( fFound != TRUE )
01678             {
01679                   pList = pList->Next;
01680             }
01681       }
01682       
01683       if( fInHistoryMode )
01684       {
01685         iCurrentHistoryPage--;
01686     
01687             // load in first page
01688         LoadNextHistoryPage( );
01689       }
01690 
01691       return( uiTime );
01692 }

01708 #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
01709 void PerformCheckOnHistoryRecord( UINT32 uiErrorCode, INT16 sSectorX, INT16 sSectorY, INT8 bSectorZ )
01710 {
01711       CHAR  zString[512];
01712 
01713       if( sSectorX > 16 || sSectorY > 16 || bSectorZ > 3 || sSectorX < -1 || sSectorY < -1 || bSectorZ < 0 )
01714       {
01715             sprintf( zString, "History page is pooched, please remember what you were just doing, send your latest save to dave, and tell him this number, Error #%d.", uiErrorCode );
01716             AssertMsg( 0, zString );
01717       }
01718 }
01719 #endif
01720 
01721 INT32 GetNumberOfHistoryPages()
01722 {
01723       HWFILE hFileHandle;
01724       UINT32      uiFileSize=0;
01725       UINT32  uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage = 0;
01726       INT32       iNumberOfHistoryPages = 0;
01727       
01728       if ( ! (FileExists( HISTORY_DATA_FILE ) ) )
01729             return( 0 );
01730 
01731       // open file
01732       hFileHandle=FileOpen( HISTORY_DATA_FILE,( FILE_OPEN_EXISTING |  FILE_ACCESS_READ ), FALSE );
01733 
01734       // failed to get file, return
01735       if(!hFileHandle)
01736       {
01737             return( 0 );
01738   }
01739 
01740       // make sure file is more than 0 length
01741   if ( FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) == 0 )
01742       {
01743     FileClose( hFileHandle );
01744             return( 0 );
01745       }
01746 
01747       uiFileSize = FileGetSize( hFileHandle ) - 1;
01748       uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage = ( NUM_RECORDS_PER_PAGE * ( sizeof( UINT8 ) + sizeof( UINT32 ) + 3*sizeof( UINT8 )+ sizeof(INT16) + sizeof( INT16 ) ) );
01749 
01750       iNumberOfHistoryPages = (INT32)( uiFileSize / uiSizeOfRecordsOnEachPage );
01751 
01752       FileClose( hFileHandle );
01753 
01754       return( iNumberOfHistoryPages );
01755 }
